revision.text:
{{Infobox Network Adapter |image1 = |image1_size = |caption = |caption2 = |pp = http://www.intel.com/content/www/us/en/wireless-products/dual-band-wireless-ac-7260-bluetooth.html |sp = |dl = |wikidevi = |wikipedia = |brand = Intel |model = Dual Band Wireless-AC 7260 |submodelappend = |submodel = |revision = |subrevision = |model_part_num = 7260NGW |page_start_date = 04/23/2013 |page_start_origon = https://wikidevi.com/wiki/Intel_Dual_Band_Wireless-AC_7260_(7260NGW) |sernum = |wlclass = AC1200 |series = |if = M.2 |if_bus_version = |ifconnector = |formfactor = |vendor_id = 8086 |device_id = 08b1 |subvendor_id = 8086 |subdevice_id = c070 |id_string = |windosid = |fcc_id = PD97260NG, PD97260NGU, CJ6UPA5125WB |icid = 1000M-7260NG |boardid = |ecc_id = |oui = 5C:51:4F,7C:7A:91,CC:3D:82 |chip1 = Intel;W308AK1L; |chip2 = |chip3 = |chip4 = |antconn = MHF4 |antenna = |txchains = 2 |rxchains = 2 |sstreams = 2 |wirelessstand = IEEE 802.11a/b/g/n/ac |802.11ac = 867 |802.11n = 300/300 |802.11g = 54 |802.11b = 11 |802.11a = 54 |wififreq = 2.4 or 5 |receive_sens = |transmit_power = |linuxdriv = |windriv = |is_manuf = No |manuf = |manuf_model = |manuf_rev = |addchip = |flags = Bluetooth, DFS, |802dot11_protocols = abgn+ac |accessible_UART = No |accessible_JTAG = |category = |availability = common |eoldate = |fccapprovdate = |estreldate = |estprice = |upc = |ean = |dx_sku = |newegg = |asin = |asin_country = |asin2 = |asin_country2 = |countrymanuf = China |powledcolor = |connactled = |spdledcolor = |leddupcolor = |dimmin = |weight = }}{{TIDTOC|adapter}} ==Overview== 802.11abgn+ac, 2x2, Dual Band Wi-Fi + Bluetooth 4.0, NGFF "PB # G83453-001", "WP2 NGFF PCIe B1 E5", and addl. PCB text (date code
'''4712''', Nov. 2012) is silkscreened on the back of the module in the FCC photos. FCC ID PD97260NGU (approval 04/22/2013) is presumably for the 7260NGW model :(7260NGWU?) for vendors using BIOS lockdown of wireless module. FCC ID PD97260NG (approval 04/17/2013) is presumably the standard 7260HMW model. There is an 00:15:00 OUI on the label pictured on the device in the FCC label shots. :Per the photos @ the [[Sony SVF13NA1EL]] 's FCC filing, it's using '''W308AK1L'''. :The antenna connectors used are MHF4. ==Links of Interest== :[http://www.intel.com/content/dam/www/public/us/en/documents/product-briefs/dual-band-wireless-ac-7260-bluetooth-brief.pdf Product Brief] ==Notes== ===Devices likely using this module=== *A Class II permissive change made 07/02/2013 states that the module :was approved for use in the '''Samsung''' Armor3-13T tablet PC :(using '''Skycross''' B130110 and B130111 antennas). :The label shot shows a device with a model NP940X3G (940X), which :appears to be the '''Samsung''' ATIV Book 9 Plus [http://ultrabooknews.com/2013/06/20/samsung-ativ-book-9-plus-launches-with-haswell-9-lite-with-amd/ (on '''Ultrabook News''')]. *Another C2PC made 10/21/2013 notes the '''Dell''' T07G is covered :(and using '''Acon''' antennas APP6P700913 + APP6P700914) ==Linux driver== *[http://linux-hardware-guide.com/2015-07-21-intel-wireless-ac-7260-hmwg-wifi-802-11ac-dual-band-bluetooth-hmc Linux Hardware Guide] The Intel Wireless-AC 7260 is a PCIe NGFF (M.2) Card which supports 802.11ac and Bluetooth connections. :The card has the PCI ID 8086:08b1 :'''lspci''' 
02:00.0 Network controller [0280]: Intel Corporation Wireless 7260 [8086:08b1] (rev 6b)
    Subsystem: Intel Corporation Dual Band Wireless-AC 7260 [8086:c070]
    Kernel driver in use: iwlwifi
    Kernel modules: iwlwifi
and is fully supported by the Linux kernel (tested under Arch Linux 1.4 with Linux kernel of version 4.1.0). :The WiFi driver (iwlwifi) is loaded automatically: :'''dmesg''' 
Intel(R) Wireless WiFi driver for Linux
Copyright(c) 2003- 2015 Intel Corporation
iwlwifi 0000:02:00.0: enabling device (0000 -> 0002)
iwlwifi 0000:02:00.0: loaded firmware version 25.27.13.0 op_mode iwlmvm
iwlwifi 0000:02:00.0: Detected Intel(R) Dual Band Wireless AC 7260, REV=0x144
iwlwifi 0000:02:00.0: L1 Enabled - LTR Disabled
iwlwifi 0000:02:00.0: L1 Enabled - LTR Disabled
The Bluetooth chipset is internally connected via USB and has the USB ID 8087:07dc :'''lsusb''' 
Bus 002 Device 002: ID 8087:07dc Intel Corp.
The chipset is fully supported and is automatically activated by the kernel: :'''dmesg''' 
Bluetooth: Core ver 2.20
NET: Registered protocol family 31
Bluetooth: HCI device and connection manager initialized
Bluetooth: HCI socket layer initialized
Bluetooth: L2CAP socket layer initialized
Bluetooth: SCO socket layer initialized
 [[Category:English Documentation]]
